addressleaf.section:
To my L. T
re
r June 10
[1591]

1591 20 June To my L. Trea
s

page.lettertext:
May it please yo
r
good L. being come to
Am-
sterdame
, I have gotten those bookes and wri-
tinges for whiche yo
r
L. writte unto me. There
is nothing missing but
e letter of
Lucas Vele
r
to his frind in Amsterdame: Whiche I have cau-
sed notw
t
standing to be required of
e shipper.
But he himself can not tell what was done w
t
it and his men are absent. Nevertheles they
shall be demaunded when they come: though it seem
by
e note w
ch
yo
r
L. sent unto me, that it was
but a letter of recommendation. I have sent
alltogether in those budgets in w
ch
they were fou
nd
and packed
e whole in canvas, whiche I have
delivered to a messenger of
Zeland,
and given
order from thens for good conveiance to yo
r
L.
I am going as this day for
Friseland,
where I heare
Count Maurice
and
e
Councel
are already arri-
ved. But
e place of their residence is yet un-
knowen: albeit I thinke it will be
Doccum
or
Leewarden:
wherof I shall advertised assoon
as
I come thither, w
ch
I hope shall be w
t
in these
two daies.
And so for this p
nt
I take my
humble leave. At Amsterdame. June 10
1591.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodl
ey
